Statement of the American Tort Reform Association
on President Clinton's Proposed Suit Against the Tobacco Industry
Jannary 20, 1999
For Immediate Release
Contact: Rose Marshall (703) 243-3949
The American Tort Reform Association (ATRA) expresses great empathy to any American who
has been confronted with a serious bealth risk associsted with smoking. But it has great concern
about the Federal Govemment distorting basic principles of tort law to accomplish goals that
should be addressed directly, through Federal regulation or excise taxes.
The basis for the Federal Goverment's Medicare claims against tobacco companies is a
thirty-seve year-oid statute, the Medical Care Recovery Act. The purpose of that stanne was to
prevent injured people from gaining a double recovery: once from the Federal Govemment and
once from the wrongdocr. It was not the statute's purpose to give the Federal Government
superio: rights to ordinary citizens.
